text: calculate the range from a list of data tom and katie are discussing the \( 5 \) plants with these heights: \( 24 \mathrm{~cm}, 17 \mathrm{~cm}, 42 \mathrm{~cm}, 26 \mathrm{~cm}, 13 \mathrm{~cm} \) tom says if all the plants were cut in half, the range wouldn't change. katie says if all the plants grew by \( 3 \mathrm{~cm} \) each, the range wouldn't change. who do you agree with? only tom
question:
Tom and Katie are discussing the \( 5 \) plants with these heights:
\( 24 \mathrm{~cm}, 17 \mathrm{~cm}, 42 \mathrm{~cm}, 26 \mathrm{~cm}, 13 \mathrm{~cm} \)
Tom says if all the plants were cut in half, the range wouldn't change.
Katie says if all the plants grew by \( 3 \mathrm{~cm} \) each, the range wouldn't change.
Who do you agree with?
subject_name: Range and Interquartile Range from a List of Data
construct_name: Calculate the range from a list of data
